articles.title: Longest partial lunar eclipse since 15th century to be visible on Nov 19 - The Federal
articles.description: The Americas, parts of Asia, Australia and the Pacific region will witness the longest partial lunar eclipse in about 600 years on November 19.
articles.content:
The Americas, parts of Asia, Australia and the Pacific region will witness the longest partial lunar eclipse in about 600 years on November 19.

articles.title: Avian influenza spreads throughout Europe and Asia - The Poultry Site
articles.description: The World Organisation for Animal Health (OIE) has received several reports of highly pathogenic avian influenza spread throughout countries in Europe and Asia.
articles.content: The poultry industry is on high alert following outbreaks in South Korea, Japan, Norway, Germany, The Netherlands, Belgium and France. The outbreaks have led to the culling of tens of millions of bir… [+883 chars]

articles.title: Bird flu spreads in Europe and Asia - Reuters
articles.description: Several outbreaks of severe bird flu in Europe and Asia have been reported in recent days to the World Organisation for Animal Health (OIE), in a sign the virus is spreading quickly again.
articles.content: Officials in protective suits head to a poultry farm for a suspected bird flu case in Higashikagawa, western Japan, in this photo taken by Kyodo November 8, 2020. Mandatory credit Kyodo/via REUTERSPA… [+1877 chars]

articles.author: YP Sport
articles.title: Yorkshire CCC racism scandal: England star Adil Rashid corroborates Azeem Rafiq’s allegations against Michael Vaughan - The Yorkshire Post
articles.description: England star Adil Rashid has come out in support of Azeem Rafiq’s allegations against Michael Vaughan regarding comments made “to a group of us Asian players”.
articles.content: Rashid, who has played 199 times for his country and was a key part of the World Cup winning side in 2019, has spent his whole career at Yorkshire but has previously kept his counsel on the racism cr… [+2927 chars]

articles.title: 7 lifestyle tips for parents whose children have diabetes - AsiaOne
